New Records: Anthony Edwards broke Kevin Garnett's record for most consecutive 20+ point games to start a season in @Timberwolves history (11 in 2000)
Others: The Minnesota Timberwolves lost to the Portland Trail Blazers by a score of 106-98. Anthony Edwards finished the game with 24 points, four rebounds, four assists, four steals, and one block while shooting 10/25 from the field and 0/9 from the three-point range in 40 minutes of playing time. The Timberwolves are 6-6 in their first 12 games, which has them as the 11th seed in the Western Conference. They are in the middle of a three-game losing streak. The Trail Blazers improved to 5-8 in 13 games, which has them as the 13th seed in the Western Conference. They will play their next game on Sunday when they host Trae Young and the Atlanta Hawks in Oregon.
